title: PH-5: Expand meta/planning level (F₅)
description: Add 3 MCP tools (design_fiber_coupling, optimize_resonator, simulate_loc_chip), global optimization framework using merge2docs algorithms (Bayesian, NSGA-II), ernie2_swarm coordination.

title: Integrate CFD simulation for microfluidics (Level 2 - Semantic)
description: Add computational fluid dynamics (CFD) simulation capabilities for microfluidic channel analysis. Critical for OOC applications. Integrate OpenFOAM or similar for velocity fields, pressure distribution, mixing dynamics, and concentration profiles.

title: Add alignment sensitivity analysis for LOC fabrication
description: Adapt plot_heatmap.py misalignment analysis for tolerance budgeting. Add AlignmentSensitivityAnalyzer with Monte Carlo simulation of coupling efficiency vs. lateral/angular errors. Addresses Level 4 gap.

title: Add dynamic functional connectivity analysis for MRI networks (Level 3 - Regulatory)
description: Implement time-varying correlation coefficients, sliding-window analysis, and graph metric evolution. Enable analysis of neural network dynamics and connectivity changes over time.

title: Implement adaptive feedback control for optical resonators (Level 3 - Regulatory)
description: Add PID control and adaptive feedback systems for ring resonator tuning. Enable sensor feedback loops for biomarker detection via refractive index shifts. Critical for LOC sensing applications.

title: PH-4: Implement integration systems (F₄)
description: Complete LOC system simulation, alignment tolerance analysis (Monte Carlo from merge2docs), whole-brain network analysis, multi-organ OOC integration. Addresses Level 4-5 gaps.

title: PH-0: Implement quantum/primitive level (F₀)
description: Quantum optics module with SymPy operators, extended material library with dispersion/thermal, surface chemistry for OOC. Adapt from entangled-pair-quantum-eraser. Addresses Level 0-1 gaps.

title: Initialize twosphere-mcp project with optical physics and MRI analysis tools
notes: Service layer (F₃-F₄) implemented with LOCSimulator, SensingService, and MRIAnalysisOrchestrator. All 15 unit tests pass. Design documents added.

title: Implement Fourier-transform spectroscopy for biomarker identification
description: Create spectroscopy_service.py with FT-spectrometer. Scan MZI path length, acquire interferogram, FFT to spectrum. Enable label-free chemical ID of proteins, DNA, metabolites in LOC devices.

title: Implement visibility analysis for interferometric biosensing
description: Adapt plot_utils.py visibility calculation for refractive index sensing. Add InterferometricSensor class with V = A/(A + 2*C0) fitting. Enable biomarker detection via phase-shift measurement. Critical for LOC sensing applications.

title: PH-6: Plan deployment/clinical pathway (F₆)
description: Clinical validation framework, FDA/CE regulatory documentation, manufacturing scale-up plan, point-of-care deployment strategy. Long-term objective (12-24 months).

title: Develop global optimization framework for LOC system design (Level 5 - Chromosomal)
description: Implement multi-objective optimization (NSGA-II, Bayesian optimization) for complete LOC system design. Merit function: Strehl ratio, MTF, coupling efficiency. Enable global parameter optimization with fabrication constraints.

title: PH-2: Complete composition level (F₂)
description: CFD integration for microfluidics, ring resonator feedback control, dynamic functional connectivity for MRI. Addresses Level 2-3 gaps.

title: Add quantum optics module for entangled-photon sensing (Level 0)
description: Create quantum_optics.py with SymPy operator framework adapted from lab6entangled.py. Implement quantum state vectors, operator algebra, expectation values. Enable quantum-enhanced sensitivity beyond shot-noise limit.

title: Implement MCP tools for service layer (design_fiber_coupling, optimize_resonator, simulate_loc_chip)
description: Add the three missing MCP tools identified in the gap analysis to expose the service layer functionality through the MCP server. These tools will enable interactive design and optimization workflows.
